service architecture came into our lives
it made life really easy because it took
this whole chunk of architecture and
divided it into manageable structures
basically it helped us divide and
conquer but it also came with a ton of
cons and one of the biggest cons of
micro service architecture was this that
every time you had to find the root
cause or an issue it would be like
finding a needle in a haystack
so this is it guys the needle is the
root cause and the haystack is a is the

architecture is made up of so we all as
an industry we started putting our

a potential solution Google came to the

dapper and dapper talked about keeping
your micro service architecture as it is
but adding three IDs along with your
metadata and passing them throughout and
those three identifiers would then be
the base of distributed tracing or
helping you find that needle in the
haystack
so the first ID is called the trace ID
which is it can be called transaction ID
activity ID what not depending on
organization to organization and that
trace ID help you identify each
transactions individually the other ID
was a span ID now within every
transaction there are multiple spans one
transaction right from and the consumer
comes onto the computer does the whole
you know there whatever they need to do
on the website and the response comes
back that whole thing one transaction
all of that is comprised of multiple
services each service will then be
uniquely identified by a span ID which
is the second ID the third ID is the
parent message ID so this ID helps you
relate that who talks to whom so this
helps set the relationship between them
so what happened with this was that we

14 and Zipkin basically took this idea
